result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua R. Vachal

records.addlTxt:
Minutes copied from the hearing in Case #15CF203 on this date:  
[MK] case called at 3:31pm. 
Defendant Joshua R. Vachal in court, in custody, with Attorney Andrew Griggs.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
This case is scheduled for Re-Sentencing today.  
Attorney Griggs indicates that the parties have an agreement on re-sentencing.  
On agreement of the parties, in Case 15CF203 the Court orders the clerk to prepare an Amended Judgment of Conviction modifying the Extended Supervision periods and the corresponding aggregate sentence-lengths so that the sentence-lengths are now that: 
--On Count #6 the Court sentences Mr. Vachal  to 5 1/2  years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  3  years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2 years and 6 months. This sentence to be served concurrent with Count #8 and it is to be served concurrent with #15CF349 and 16CF150, .
--On Count #8 the Court sentences Mr. Vachal  to 5 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  3 years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2 years. This sentence to be served concurrent with Count #6 and it is to be served concurrent with #15CF349 and 16CF150.

Attorney Griggs indicates that, related to the Department of Corrections letter of 9/19/16, the parties have a stipulation on pre-sentence credit.  The Court orders the Judgments of Conviction amended to reflect the stipulated days credit in each of these cases: 
--in case #15CF203:  85 days credit total 
--in case #15CF349:  20 days of credit
--in case #15CF383:  57 days of credit [Attorney Griggs made reference during the hearing that there would be no JOC to amend on the read-in case, however calculation of days credit were part of the stipulation]
--in case 16CF150:    24 days of credit 
recess: 3:40pm

[Post-hearing off-record: in response to the clerk's inquiry, the Court clarifies that these sentence-credit calculations are as of the date of the original sentencing; these number of days credit do not include credit that has accumulating from the date of the original sentencing until today.  The Court indicates that the amended JOC's may reflect that these sentence-credit orders are nunc pro tunc to the date of the original Sentencing Hearing.]
Jdgmt of Bail/Bond Forf mailed to Defendant - Unable to Fwd
of the Sentencing Hearing held on May 9, 2016 before the Honorable David J Wambach
Revised Criminal Case Settlement

records.addlTxt:
Cases 15CF203, 15CF349, 15CF383 and 16CF150 called together at 1:51pm [mo]
Defendant Joshua R. Vachal in court with attorney Andrew Robert Griggs.  DA Susan Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

DA Happ submits a Victim Impact Statement for 15CF383

recess: 2:10pm--2:13pm

As to Case 16CF150:
Mr. Vachal  waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived

Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; pleas of " NO CONTEST  " entered On Case 15CF203, Counts #6 and #8, On Case 15CF349, Count #2, and On Case 16CF150, Count #5; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Mr. Vachal  guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads in and dismisses: Counts #2 and #4 of Case 15CF203, Count #1 of Case 15CF349, Counts #1, #2, #3, #4 and #6 of Case 16CF150 and Case 15CF383.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
Statements made by family members of Mr. Vachal
Statement made by Mr. Vachal


On Case 15CF203, Counts #6 and #8:
The Court sentences Mr. Vachal  to  7  years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  3  years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of  4 years, per count, this sentence is to commence FORTHWITH; this sentence is to be served concurrent with eachother and to be served concurrent with 15CF349 and 16CF150

On Case 15CF349, Count #2:
The Court sentences Mr. Vachal  to 3   years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of   1 year, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2  years.  This sentence is to be served concurrent with 15CF203 and 16CF150.

On Case 16CF150, Count #5:
The Court sentences Mr. Vachal   to  3  years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  1  year, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of  2 years.  This sentence is to be served concurrent with 15CF203 and 15CF349


The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
 

The Court gives  73   days credit for time already served, to applied to each case since they are ordered concurrent.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision, the conditions as layed out in the Criminal Case Settlement

[which are:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations
 per agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as required by the Agent
--
random drug and/or alcohol screening
--obtain/maintain employment and/or education program per agent
--no possession of controlled substance without a valid prescription
--no contact with Julie Baker
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--no possession or ingestion of alcohol 
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per agent
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand
--to pay all statutory costs 
--to pay statutory costs]

and to pay $99 in subpoena fees and to make a good faith effort at pay aunt back for bond money she posted in the amount of $5500 (Surety Janke)

As to Cases 15CF203 and 15CF383 (Bail/Bond Forfeiture Hearing occurs):
--statement made by DA Happ
--statement made by surety
--argument given by Atty. Griggs

The Court orders that the $3000 cash will not be forfeit but will be applied to the costs/ fees/ assessments; the remainder will be returned to the surety(Janke)
The Court orders the $2500 cash be forfeit and directs it to the general fund. 

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
recess: 3:40pm
Bail/Bond Forfeiture Hearing on May 9, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Acknowledgement of Review by the Court
Granted; Atty. Griggs request to appear by phone
AMENDED

Cases 15CF203, 15CF349, 15CF383 called together at 11:42am [mo]
Defendant Joshua R. Vachal in court, in custody.
Attorney Andrew Robert Griggs appears via telephone.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court reviews with Atty. Griggs the State's request for warrant.
Atty. Griggs indicates that he is aware of Mr. Vachal's new charges
Atty. Griggs verifies receipt of State's Motion for Bond Modification

The Court finds that warrants in each of the cases to be executed.

As to State's Motion for Bond Modification:
--Arguments given by Atty. Griggs
--The Court finds that there is enough evidence for the Court to conclude that the Defendant has failed to comply with bond.

The Court grants the State's Motion for Bond Modification
The Court requires a $2,000 CASH bond in each of the Cases 15CF203, 15CF349, 15CF383 (in addition to any bond already posted); totalling $6,000


The Court finds that the $5,500 bond amount  is in default and orders it to be forfeited.[Cases 15CF383 and 15CF203 according to State's Motion]
recess: 11:58am

Arraignment at 01-05-2016 04:00 pm

[MK] cases #15CF203 and #15CF383 called at 9:12am. 
Defendant Joshua R. Vachal in court, in custody, with Attorney Steven J. Luchsinger.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Case #15CF383: 
--ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance. 
--Mr. Vachal waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

--ADA Hall files the Information
--on request of the Defense, the Court schedules Arraignment on a later date

As to Case #15CF203: 
--ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance
--Attorney Luchsinger indicates that the Defense has no challenge to the State's Notice to Admit Statements  
--the Court finds that Mr. Vachal has three prior convictions for St. 906.09 purposes
--after hearing arguments from counsel on the State's Motion to Modify Bond, the Court finds the already-posted $2500 Cash Bond to be in Default; this Bond is forfeited.  
--the Court requires a new Cash Bond in the amount of $3,000 with the same non-monetary conditions as previously ordered and an added condition of:  No Contact with Stephanie B.
recess 9:35am.

NEXT:  Bail Forfeiture Hearing in Case #15CF203 and Arraignment in #15CF383 on 1/5/16 at 4:00pm.

Defendant Joshua R. Vachal appears in custody, via video, from the Jefferson County Jail. Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint, appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Court finds the proceedings are sight and sound sufficient
Atty De La Rosa informs the Court that he has one more item to cover with Mr. Vachal so unsure if he will qualify for representation, requests the Court cover rights with Mr. Vachal

Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given.
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited

Court requires a $2,500 cash bond, with conditions:

-No possession or consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs
-No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores 
-No acts or threats of violence towards any persons 
-No contact with Stephanie Beam
(*Direct or indirect contact prohibitions include but are not limited to phone calls, letters, emails, texts, social media, other electronic means and no one can contact the person on your behalf except an attorney.) 
-No presence at W9194 Ripley Rd. #60, Oakland
